title: datalad update taking very long
body:
I have mentioned this problem before but now is happening again and is worth an issue.

#### What is the problem?
Merging some relatively minor modifications in subdatasets takes hours. This is a parent dataset named "freesurfer " which contains ~440 sudatasets named "sub-*". Total size about 1.3Tb, with 1.3+ million files overall, spread of course in the subdatasets.
We work in a collabroative environment with one master location and collaborators cloning and making changes. When things are ready from a collaborator, I pull the changes in the master location following two steps:
1. Add the location of the collaborator as sibling (with `--recursive` to add respective siblings to subdatasets).
2. Run `datalad update --recursive --sibling mandy --merge`.
The merge seems to go quickly for about 10 minutes where I can see messages showing fetching and applying for each subdataset. Then the process does something after the last `update(ok)` which takes a couple of hours before stating `action summary` and returning the prompt.
```console
[INFO   ] Applying updates to <Dataset path=/DATA/FEDERATED_DATASETS/STUDY1/data/processed/freesurfer/sub-T99599>
update(ok): sub-T99599 (dataset)
action summary:
  save (notneeded: 1)
  update (ok: 442)
```

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Can't share this huge dataset, but if you have some datasets this big, you could try to reproduce it.

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
0.12.0rc6 (installed from github some days ago)

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
No

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)
Datalad is the future of data organization :)
